FuncDef: The display isis lsdb command displays the LSDB information of IS-IS.
CLIs: display isis lsdb [ verbose [ no-name ] | { level-1 | level-2 } | { local | <lspid> | is-name <isname> } ] * [ <process-id> | { vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> } ]
display isis <process-id> lsdb [ { level-1 | level-2 } | verbose [ no-name ] | { is-name <isname> | local | <lspid> } ] *

ParaDef.Info:
Displays detailed information about the LSDB.
-

Displays detailed information about the LSDB, without the alias information.
-

Displays information about the Level-1 LSDB.
-

Displays information about the Level-2 LSDB.
-

Displays information about the local LSDB.
-

Specifies an LSP ID.
The value is in dotted decimal notation, ranging from 16 to 20 and in the format of ####.####.####.##-##, such as 0050.0500.5004.00-00.

Specifies a dynamic hostname.
The value is a string and it has two values:
symbolic-name: the length is from 1 to 64.symbolic-name.XX-XX: the length is from 1 to 70.
When quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Specifies an IS-IS process ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.

Specifies the VPN instance to which an IS-IS process belongs.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. In addition, the VPN instance name must not be _public_. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Examples: LSPID                 Seq Num      Checksum      Holdtime      Length  ATT/P/OL
LSPID                 Seq Num      Checksum      Holdtime      Length  ATT/P/OL

Lan-SRv6-X-Sid   2001:db8:1::2         0000.0000.0002  B:0 S:0 P:0 Algorithm:0 Weight:0
P2P-SRv6-X-Sid   2001:db8:1::3         B:0 S:0 P:0 Algorithm:0 Weight:0
P2P-SRv6-X-Sid   2001:db8:1::5         B:0 S:0 P:0 Algorithm:0 Weight:0

Segment Routing MSD   Max-SL: 10   Max-End-Pop: 10   Max-T-Ins: 10   Max-T-Encap: 10   Max-End-D: 10
SRv6 Locator 1:1::/64                         MT: 2 Metric: 0 D: 0 Algorithm: 0

SRv6 End Sid   2001:db8:1::2/128                   Function: End         P: 1  U: 0
SRv6 Locator 1:1::/64                         MT: 0 Metric: 0 D: 0 Algorithm: 0
SRv6 End Sid   2001:db8:1::1/128                   Function: End         P: 0  U: 0
SRv6 End Sid   2001:db8:1::2/128                   Function: End         P: 1  U: 0
SID Binding  2.2.2.2/32 F:0 M:0 S:0 D:0 A:0 Weight:0 Range:1

Segment Routing MSD   BMI: 10   Max-SL: 10   Max-End-Pop: 10   Max-T-Ins: 10   Max-T-Encap: 10   Max-End-D: 10

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To view the LSDB information of IS-IS, run the display isis lsdb command. If no level is specified, information about Level-1 and Level-2 LSDBs is displayed.
If verbose is specified, you can view detailed information about the IS-IS LSDB, including the multi-topology (MT) ID, MT neighbor ID, and IPv6 prefix.
